blog.name: saanphoenix
blog.title: Viva la Vida
blog.description: The name's Saan. This is a personal blog that's overrun by all things Supernatural. Expect rants, angels, and heavy amounts of bitterness and sarcasm.

summary: Buncha people on YouTubes be stating that Crowley's eyes weird them out and don't seem right and, uh, yeah, I sure hope they...
body:
Buncha people on YouTubes be stating that Crowley’s eyes weird them out and don’t seem right and, uh, yeah, I sure hope they do.

They’re slitted snake eyes. On a person. In real life, not the Animes. That’s going to look weird to most anybody. You’re not used to seeing that. The pupil is all Wrong. The size of the eye looks Off. Your uncanny valley senses are probably tingling.

Honestly, I’m used to it. I’ve seen enough behind-the-scenes and promotional whatzits that it doesn’t seem off anymore. Just like the live-action Pokemon in Detective Pikachu, or whatever, are starting to not look as terrifying as the first time I laid eyes on Jigglypuff.

Don’t fault the poor man for his snake eyes. They’re what you asked for.

Don’t fault the poor man for his snake eyes. They’re what you asked for.

Don’t fault the poor man for his snake eyes. They’re what you asked for.

blog.name: brainlicking
blog.title: art blog whoo!
blog.description:
G'day, this is the art blog of S Rosengaard. I am a graphic novelist who is in the process of creating my first story. 

Contained within will be copious amounts of content featuring my original characters, and less copious amounts of fanart. 
FAIR WARNING, gore and body horror art are unflinchingly posted here.


(I don’t take requests, but if you inbox something interesting, I may (or may not) draw it during my free time.)

tags: I MIGHT draw my interpretation of their human-shaped bodies
I had fun colouring this hahaa
summary: I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens!  Firstly for Crowley I...
caption:
I felt like designing my interpretations of the Eden!forms for Aziraphale and Crowley from Good Omens! 

Firstly for Crowley I wanted to give him multiple eyes as a remained of the times where he used to be an angel, and of course horns for his current demon status.

For Aziraphale, since he’s the guardian of the eastern gate, I wanted to give him a dawn-like colour palette and starry skin, as the sun rises in the east.

(open picture in new tab to get in the details)

✧ tip jar ✧ RedBubble ✧  Etsy ✧

summary: I've seen a few posts about how seeing Crowley cry in the trailer made people cry and I get the feeling but personally I bursted...
body: I’ve seen a few posts about how seeing Crowley cry in the trailer made people cry and I get the feeling but personally I bursted into tears because Aziraphale’s bookshop is burning and I am the kind of person tearing up each time someone mentions the library of Alexandria

summary: Objectively Aziraphale is also difficult to write because he has believed One Thing Only for 6000 years and yet he is constantly...
body: Objectively Aziraphale is also difficult to write because he has believed One Thing Only for 6000 years and yet he is constantly acting contrary to that One Thing, but I am an expert in that sort of double-think so writing that comes naturally.

summary: Basically what I’m saying is that Crowley is hard to write because all his words and actions are filtered through 9002+ layers...
body: Basically what I’m saying is that Crowley is hard to write because all his words and actions are filtered through 9002+ layers of analysis and anxiety and as a narrator I just don’t have time to sort through all that every time he does a thing!!!

tags: he still ends up facing the truth EVENTUALLY
and until then tends to sort of drift aimlessly in its direction
but if he doesn't want to see it he drags his heals real hard
summary: As I make my first stumbling attempt at writing Good Omens fic, one thing I am discovering about the Crowley in my head is that...
body:
As I make my first stumbling attempt at writing Good Omens fic, one thing I am discovering about the Crowley in my head is that he is very bad at thoroughgoing self-deception, (he always asks the right questions in spite of himself), but he is so good at alternate explanations and caveats that he is able to hold himself at arm’s length from uncomfortable truths.

And part of that genuinely is him avoiding things he doesn’t want to face, but part of it is an endless low-key anxiety spiral that results in his overanalyzing every possible option and being terrified of making the wrong choice.

For example, I vacillate on whether “sauntered vaguely downward” is a reliable description of Crowley’s fall because the narration throughout Good Omens tends to minimize the trauma of his experiences, but it does make sense for the Crowley I imagine. Because hell is right to say something is wrong with heaven, and Crowley knows it, but that Satan fellow seems like a right bonehead, and does he really want to get himself involved in this mess? So he never truly takes a stance with hell, neither quite faces the ugliness of either option, but when the lines are drawn he just sort of finds himself a bit more on the side of hell, without ever having admitted to himself that he’d made up his mind.

Similarly, when he meets Aziraphale he sort of knows right away that he likes this angel and wants to spend time with him, but for all he knows this is heaven playing a trick on him, or just a bit of lingering nostalgia for his old life, and anyhow Aziraphale made it clear that he is on the side of Good and believes that Crowley can only be Bad, so that’s that. But they keep spending time with one another regardless, and Crowley is sort of aware that he’s doing it on purpose, that he likes doing it, but whenever he comes close to really admitting the significance of that he spirals into a million excuses and alternatives. Then one day it hits him that they’re proper friends, have been for ages, and that he cares for Aziraphale. And that’s terrifying on any number of levels, he’d never have made up his mind to put himself in such a position, but then he went and did it anyway while he was distracting himself with excuses.

Basically, whereas Aziraphale has one foolproof explanation (ineffability) that keeps him from facing uncomfortable truths, Crowley does see the uncomfortable truth and buries it beneath every alternate explanation under and over the sun. 

And then eventually the truth becomes too glaring to ignore so he just throws hands and goes the fuck to sleep.

summary: vox machina as good omens quotes
title: vox machina as good omens quotes
body:
Vax: Plan B had failed. Everything depended on Plan C, and there was one drawback to this: he had only ever planned as far as B.
Vex: Notoriety wasn't as good as fame, but was heaps better than obscurity.
Keyleth: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft are written by men.
Percy: It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people.
Grog: It has been said that civilization is twenty-four hours and two meals away from barbarism.
Pike: Anyway, if you stop tellin' people it's all sorted out afer they're dead, they might try sorting it all out while they're alive. 
Scanlan: Hell may have all the best composers, but heaven has all the best choreographers.
Bonus Tary: Just remember I’ll have known that, deep down inside, you were just enough of a bastard to be worth liking.

dialogue.name: Vax
dialogue.label: Vax:
dialogue.phrase: Plan B had failed. Everything depended on Plan C, and there was one drawback to this: he had only ever planned as far as B.

dialogue.name: Vex
dialogue.label: Vex:
dialogue.phrase: Notoriety wasn't as good as fame, but was heaps better than obscurity.

dialogue.name: Keyleth
dialogue.label: Keyleth:
dialogue.phrase: Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft are written by men.

dialogue.name: Percy
dialogue.label: Percy:
dialogue.phrase: It may help to understand human affairs to be clear that most of the great triumphs and tragedies of history are caused, not by people being fundamentally good or fundamentally bad, but by people being fundamentally people.

dialogue.name: Grog
dialogue.label: Grog:
dialogue.phrase: It has been said that civilization is twenty-four hours and two meals away from barbarism.

dialogue.name: Pike
dialogue.label: Pike:
dialogue.phrase: Anyway, if you stop tellin' people it's all sorted out afer they're dead, they might try sorting it all out while they're alive.

dialogue.name: Scanlan
dialogue.label: Scanlan:
dialogue.phrase: Hell may have all the best composers, but heaven has all the best choreographers.

dialogue.name: Bonus Tary
dialogue.label: Bonus Tary:
dialogue.phrase: Just remember I’ll have known that, deep down inside, you were just enough of a bastard to be worth liking.

summary: In which:  the GO’s feed from SXSW is killing me and  I need to vent; Bill and Skaggs are all us long-time GO fans Nancy is all...
caption:
In which:

  • the GO’s feed from SXSW is killing me and  I need to vent;
  • Bill and Skaggs are all us long-time GO fans
  • Nancy is all of us in May (and a SPN fan)
  • cast and writer are killing me, arrest them, please
  • William Shatner didn’t read the book (or he did and that’s his way of joking)
  • the photos from the activation make me want to enter the screen because I can’t be there today - aaahhh

summary: Hi! I was reading your Good Omens post about seeing Aziraphale and Crowley as a QPR and i wanted to ask... What is the...
question: Hi! I was reading your Good Omens post about seeing Aziraphale and Crowley as a QPR and i wanted to ask... What is the difference about a BroTP and a QPR? Both are not sexual and not romantic, just platonic love, so I got a little lost when you differentiated between both. I hope it's ok to ask this, I'm just a little confused because I can't quess the difference... and I would like to know. Thanks.
answer:
Well, a BroTP is sorta like being besties, but as I understand it, a QPR would be something like a platonic partnership, where there is a deeper bond than what you would just describe as close friends, but without a romantic component.  It can include sex (not all aro people are ace), or domestic partnership, but is not necessarily monogamous (as is also the case with non aro-ace people).

I think some of the confusion lies in the fact that our society interprets physical/emotional closeness as automatically meaning there is a romantic tension there, but that is not always the case.  I can’t speak to how other aro’s feel about QPR’s, this is just my own POV.  I’m aro, but I also love cuddles, hand holding, etc.  I just don’t associate those things with romance or sex.  But honestly, it’s kind of difficult to describe if you aren’t aromantic.  I don’t want to get too personal, but although I’m aro, I am also married, and the bond I have with my spouse is *nothing* like the bond I have with other people.  It’s a completely different level, and a bit indescribable.  Hope that helps, but I may have just confused you further, LOL!
